meanings.definition: A person who behaves obsequiously to someone in power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The trucklers surrounded the king, hoping to gain favor.
meanings.sent2: The court was full of trucklers, always eager to please the queen.
meanings.sent3: The group of trucklers tripped over each other trying to impress the mayor.
meanings.sent4: She saw through the fake smiles of the trucklers, knowing they were only after her influence.
meanings.sent5: The image of the trucklers bowing and scraping stayed in his mind long after the event.

meanings.definition: To act in a subservient manner to someone in power or authority.
meanings.sent1: He would trucklers to his boss, always agreeing with whatever was said.
meanings.sent2: The employees would often trucklers to the demands of the supervisor.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to trucklers to the whims of its playful owner.
meanings.sent4: The politician would never trucklers to the lobbyists, standing firm on his principles.
meanings.sent5: The students would trucklers to the strict teacher, afraid of getting in trouble.
